circumstances: After a night takeoff from Kansas City Airport, while on a mail flight, the airplane encountered difficulties to gain height when it stalled and crashed near the runway end. Both pilots were seriously injured and the aircraft was destroyed by a post crash fire.
probable_cause:
Stall during initial climb caused by an inadequate preflight preparation on part of the flying crew. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Airframe ice, 
- Icing conditions including sleet, freezing rain, 
- Improperly loaded aircraft-weight and CofG,
- Frost on wings, 
- Aircraft overt gross takeoff weight.
